subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Reports
msgSnippet: ... And if it doesn t, you can always modify your algorithm to become a selector[1] and nest that into the  inside . Stefan Footnotes: [1]
messageBody:
On Wed, 14 Apr 2004, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:

> Look at the <batchtest> task, which generates a test suite by
> scanning a region of the file system for files matching a certain
> pattern. I'd bet it does what your code does.

And if it doesn't, you can always modify your algorithm to become a
selector[1] and nest that into the <fileset> inside <batchtest>.

Stefan

Footnotes:
[1] http://ant.apache.org/manual/CoreTypes/selectors.html
